required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment With Romosozumab Versus Denosumab to Improve Bone Mineral Density and Architecture in Subacute SCI
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment With Romosozumab Versus Denosumab to Improve Bone Mineral Density and Architecture in Subacute SCI

lead_sponsor.agency: James J. Peters Veterans Affairs Medical Center

clinical_study.source: James J. Peters Veterans Affairs Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the proposed work is to determine whether administration for 12 months of romosozumab followed by 12 months of denosumab will maintain bone mass at the knee in subjects with subacute SCI compared to 24 months of denosumab administration alone.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Arm 1: romosozumab administered monthly from baseline to month 11 followed by denosumab at month 12 and 18. Arm 2: denosumab administered at baseline, month 6, 12, and 18

primary_outcome.measure: Bone mineral density (BMD) of the distal femur metaphysis
primary_outcome.description: BMD at the distal femur metaphysis will be obtained by dual energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Romosozumab Baseline to Month 11 followed by Denosumab Month 12 to Month 24
arm_group.description: Of the forty (40) individuals with subacute spinal cord injury (SCI) enrolled in this study, twenty (20) participants will be randomly selected to receive romosozumab (210mg SQ) once a month for 12 months. After 12 months the same twenty (20) individuals will receive denosumab (60mg SQ) at month 12 and 18.

Of the forty (40) individuals with subacute spinal cord injury (SCI) enrolled in this study, twenty (20) participants will be randomly selected to receive denosumab (60 mg SQ) at baseline and 6, 12, and 18 months.

intervention.description: Romosozumab (Amgen Inc., Thousand Oaks, CA) 210mg SQ administered each month
intervention.arm_group_label: Romosozumab Baseline to Month 11 followed by Denosumab Month 12 to Month 24

intervention.description: Denosumab (Amgen Inc., Thousand Oaks, CA) 60 mg SQ administered every six months
intervention.arm_group_label: Romosozumab Baseline to Month 11 followed by Denosumab Month 12 to Month 24

facility.name: James J. Peters VA Medical Center

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director VA RR&D National Center of Excellence for the Medical Consequences of Spinal Cord Injury
